data.title: Richard Jefferson, Basketball Player
data.meta_description: Richard Jefferson stats and bio. Stats averages season by season. Quick access to game by game stats.
data.text:
Richard Jefferson - Points

Richard Jefferson scores a career high 42 points (2004)

On December 22, 2004, Richard Jefferson set his career high in points in a NBA game. That day he scored 42 points in New Jersey's home win against Cleveland, 92-90. He also had 6 rebounds, 7 assists, 1 steal and 1 block. He shot 10/16 from two, 2/4 from three, shooting at 60.0% from the field. He also shot 16/17 from the free-throw line.

Richard Jefferson - Rebounds

Richard Jefferson grabs a career high 21 rebounds (2004)

On November 05, 2004, Richard Jefferson set his career high in rebounds in a NBA game. That day he grabbed 21 rebounds in New Jersey's road win against Chicago, 106-111. He also had 26 points, 9 assists, 3 steals and 1 block.

Richard Jefferson - Assists

Richard Jefferson gives a career high 12 assists (2004)

On April 04, 2004, Richard Jefferson tied his career high in assists in a NBA game. That day he dished 12 assists in New Jersey's home win against Atlanta, 106-89. He also had 20 points, 7 rebounds, 1 steal.

Richard Jefferson - Steals

Richard Jefferson has a career high 5 steals (2003)

On November 14, 2003, Richard Jefferson tied his career high in steals in a NBA game. That day he reached 5 steals in New Jersey's home win against New York, 85-80. He also had 8 points, 8 rebounds and 4 assists.

Richard Jefferson - Blocks

Richard Jefferson blocks a career high 4 shots (2002)

On January 10, 2002, Richard Jefferson tied his career high in blocks in a NBA game. That day he went for 4 blocks in New Jersey's home win against LA Clippers, 108-89. He also had 13 points, 1 rebound and 4 assists.

Richard Jefferson - Efficiency

Richard Jefferson records a career high 45 efficiency rating (2004)

On December 22, 2004, Richard Jefferson set his career high in efficiency in a NBA game. That day he accomplished 45 efficiency in New Jersey's home win against Cleveland, 92-90. He also had 42 points, 6 rebounds and 7 assists.
